name: IO.NET
description: io.net is a decentralized GPU network offering H100 (PCIe/SXM) and other GPUs via marketplace pricing, with significant cost differences vs hyperscalers.

features.title: Massive Decentralized Network
features.description: Access to 300,000+ verified GPUs from 139 countries with 6,000+ cluster-ready GPUs

features.title: Rapid Deployment
features.description: Deploy clusters in under 90 seconds with auto-scaling capabilities

features.title: Multiple Deployment Options
features.description: Choose from containers, Ray clusters, or bare metal based on workload needs

features.title: Built on Ray.io
features.description: Uses the same distributed computing framework that OpenAI used to train GPT-3

features.title: IO Intelligence
features.description: AI models, smart agents, and API integration for workflow automation

features.title: Mesh VPN Security
features.description: Kernel-level VPN with secure mesh protocols for data protection

features.title: Flexible Pricing
features.description: Pay with $IO tokens, no long-term contracts or complex KYC requirements

pros: Up to 90% cost savings compared to AWS, GCP, and Azure
Fastest deployment time in the industry (under 90 seconds)
Massive global network with 300,000+ GPUs available
No waitlists, approvals, or long-term contracts required
Built on proven Ray.io framework used by OpenAI
Wide range of GPU types from consumer to enterprise grade
cons: Newer platform compared to established cloud providers
Decentralized nature may have performance consistency variations
Less comprehensive documentation compared to major cloud providers
Performance depends on distributed node quality and connectivity

gettingStarted.title: Sign up for IO.NET
gettingStarted.description: Create an account on the IO.NET platform with no complex KYC requirements

gettingStarted.title: Acquire $IO tokens
gettingStarted.description: Purchase $IO tokens for compute payments or add other supported payment methods

gettingStarted.title: Choose deployment type
gettingStarted.description: Select from containers, Ray clusters, or bare metal based on your workload

gettingStarted.title: Configure cluster
gettingStarted.description: Specify GPU requirements, region preferences, and scaling options

gettingStarted.title: Deploy in seconds
gettingStarted.description: Launch your cluster in under 90 seconds and start your AI/ML workloads

computeServices.name: IO Cloud
computeServices.description: On-demand GPU clusters for AI/ML workloads with multiple deployment options

instanceTypes.name: Container as a Service
instanceTypes.description: Containerized deployments with familiar tooling and native support
features: Scalable from single GPU to massive clusters

instanceTypes.name: Ray Clusters
instanceTypes.description: One-line deployment for ML workloads with pre-configured environments
features: Built on Ray.io distributed computing framework
Support for PyTorch, TensorFlow, and other ML frameworks
Optimized for distributed training and inference

instanceTypes.name: Bare Metal
instanceTypes.description: Direct GPU access with root-level control for maximum performance

computeServices.name: IO Intelligence
computeServices.description: AI models, smart agents, and API integration platform

computeServices.name: Marketplace
computeServices.description: Decentralized pool of GPU providers with unified APIs and competitive pricing.

instanceTypes.name: H100 PCIe
instanceTypes.description: Marketplace H100 PCIe offers from multiple suppliers.
features: Transparent marketplace pricing with multiple tiers
Pricing varies by supplier and staking tier

instanceTypes.name: H100 SXM5
instanceTypes.description: Marketplace H100 SXM offers with high-bandwidth interconnect.
features: Pricing varies by region and supplier

gpuServices.description: Cost-effective consumer-grade GPUs for development and testing

gpuServices.name: GPU Catalog
gpuServices.description: Range spans consumer to datacenter GPUs.

pricingOptions.name: Ray Cluster Pricing
pricingOptions.description: Most cost-effective option for distributed ML workloads using Ray framework

pricingOptions.name: Container Pricing
pricingOptions.description: Standard containerized deployments with Docker support

pricingOptions.name: Bare Metal Pricing
pricingOptions.description: Premium pricing for direct hardware access and maximum performance

pricingOptions.name: Auto-scaling
pricingOptions.description: Dynamic pricing based on actual resource usage with automatic scaling

regions: Global distributed network across 139 countries with intelligent geographic clustering and latency optimization
support: Documentation portal, Discord community (500,000+ members), Telegram support, and direct engineering support for GPU and driver questions
uniqueSellingPoints: Largest decentralized GPU network with 300,000+ verified GPUs
Up to 90% cost savings compared to traditional cloud providers
Built on Ray.io framework used by OpenAI for GPT-3 training
No waitlists, approvals, or long-term contracts required
Native $IO token economy with staking and rewards
Proof of Time-Lock verification system for guaranteed compute availability
tagline: Decentralized GPU network for AI development
